Debating in Reagan's shadow, Giuliani bucks GOP field





Front-runner Rudy Giuliani broke with the other nine Republicans in the
party's first debate of the presidential campaign, saying that it would be OK
if the Supreme Court upheld its landmark ruling on abortion rights.

Military: New Iraqi school had bombs built in





American soldiers discovered a girls school being built north of Baghdad had
become an explosives-rigged "death trap," the U.S. military said Thursday.

Deadly thunderstorms leave Texas in tatters





Days of deadly storms flooded roads, damaged homes and knocked down trees in
Texas, and about 200,000 homes and businesses remained in the dark Thursday.

Queen begins visit by meeting Virginia Tech survivors





Queen Elizabeth II began her first visit to the United States in 16 years with
a message of sympathy and sorrow for the victims of last month's massacre at
Virginia Tech.

Pastor preaches against complaining





The Rev. Will Bowen tries not to complain. He wants everyone else to stop
carping, too -- all 6 billion of us on the planet.

Five Americans accused of bounty hunting in Mexico





Mexican authorities have arrested five U.S. citizens and accused them of
trying to kidnap two men in Mexico.

Drugging dad locked boy in cage, police say





A boy was locked up in a small dog cage when he was being punished and while
his father used drugs, and he sometimes had to wear a shock collar,
authorities said.

Deal reached on climate change report





International delegates agreed Friday that the world has the technology and
money to limit catastrophic global warming, but that it must act now to reduce
the harmful effects of greenhouse gas emissions.

U.S. and Syria discuss foreign fighters in Iraq





U.S. Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice said she raised the issue of foreign
fighters entering Iraq from Syria in talks with Syria's foreign minister
Thursday.





FULL STORY
      WATCH VIDEO
















Local UK elections seen as referendum on Tony Blair





Prime Minister Tony Blair sidestepped electoral catastrophe Friday but voters
handed the outgoing leader a string of bruising municipal defeats -- and his
governing Labour was locked in a battle for Scotland with a nationalist party
that vowed to push for independence.





FULL STORY
      WATCH VIDEO
















U.S. missile shield talks still on





The Bush administration said Thursday it will launch negotiations this month
to deploy a missile shield in Eastern Europe despite Russia's objections and
growing opposition in the Democratic-led U.S. Congress.

S&P, Dow make more history

time in more than six years and the Dow industrials ending at a record high
for the sixth time in seven sessions.

OAKLAND -- It ended and there was Don Nelson waiting to start his press

FDA checks food manufacturers; pet food recall expands

make sure none of the contaminated products found in pet food have reached

'Monitor Queen' of Malaysia gives computers a new life





In her native Malaysia, Mary Tiong developed a reputation for selling leftover
computer monitors for a large manufacturer behind the industry's best-known
brands. She earned a nickname: The Monitor Queen.

Paris Hilton should be jailed for 45 days for violating terms of her probation
